name: Rouge, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Rouge June 28th through July 1st for a sightseeing/girls weekend.
reviews.title: Has a fun vibe...

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel later than expected ~ 11:45 PM versus 10:30 PM (our plane was delayed out of TIA)~ upon our arrival we were told they only had a king room available (no double rooms were clean) but we could move rooms the next day. (FYI... we booked a double room months ago.)
reviews.title: Great location, cool rooms, awesome beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and clean but a tad bit worn. (i.e. wallpaper was peeling in some areas and there was visable wear and tear in general). The bed was very comfortable and large enough for the two of us to sleep as if we had our own beds. The TV had limited channels, I found the lamp/light switches difficult to locate and the A/C was tempermental at times.
reviews.title: Great Vibe...Bad Shower

reviews.text: The bathroom was small and beat up but very clean. Lots of towels/linens and nice Aveda amenities. There was limited light in the bathroom and, as other reviewers have posted, the shower pressure was not the greatest. The water temp was H-O-T but that's better than cold, right?
reviews.title: Rouge was okay

reviews.text: The honor bar was a life saver - lots of reasonably (compared to other hotels) priced options such as water, fruit juice and sodas. We could not locate an ice machine on the 10th floor.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!

likes.liked: — Free wireless internet, spacious room, decor, location, staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at The Rouge with my boyfriend twice in the last year. Big fans of Kimpton Group hotels, we had thought we'd stay at different properties owned by the company in Washington, but The Rouge is so ideal (location, room size, vibe) that we stayed there twice in a row.
reviews.title: Loooove The Rouge

likes.liked: — Location, decor, staff, price ($125 through Kimpton website)
likes.disliked: — Getting a tad dingy with age

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kimptons are boutique hotels - each has it's own style. The Rouge is, as the name suggests, red everywhere. The lights are low and lounge-like. The check in desk is small and the staff is friendly. We know DC, so we didn't need too much help, but the one time we asked them for a lunch suggestion, they came through. The bar is small, but plush. It can get a little loud at times, so go early if you want to cozy up to someone with a nice beverage.
reviews.title: Funky, modern and stupid. We absolutely loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very large and well furnished. The long desk is great for spreading out, though I've never tried to do any work in a room here. The desk also has a large surge suppressor (great for the cell, iPod, etc.). The far wall is all windows, but thick, velvet drapes block out the light 100% if drawn. The beds are comfortable, but I personally would have liked more than a sheet and light duvet for blankets.
reviews.title: Great experience at Rouge Hotel

reviews.text: The bathrooms are were a little wear is evident (this is one of the older Kimpton hotels in DC). Nothing is dramatically wrong with the bathrooms, you'll just notice that the faucets wiggle a little or the shelves have some scratches.
reviews.title: BE CAREFUL with your credit card

likes.liked: — I did feel like a roc kstar.
likes.disliked: — worn soft goods in the rooms/lobby/etc

reviews.title: Great find
reviews.text: Outside the bathroom is a little hallway with a large, metal bureau. Half of it is drawers (some very deep) and the other half is for the honor bar and fridge. Both times we've stayed at The Rouge, we've emptied the fridge and put our own beverages in it (no objections from housekeeping or management).
I stayed here for 12 nights whilst on business in DC.
reviews.title: Hip hotel, a little far from downtown and a metro

reviews.text: My first impression of the room was - wow!, as i like design boutique hotels.
reviews.title: Tacky-chic east of Dupont Circle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a massive bed, chair and comfy sofa plus desk area. Of the room was a small space where the mini bar was and then there was a small bathroom.
reviews.title: Fun, centrally located hotel in DC

reviews.text: As a welcome i had 2 bottles of water and 2 apples, but i only received 1 supply, and considering the length of my stay in would have been nice to get a second supply.
reviews.title: A hip hotel with impeccable service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I joined the Kimpton intouch club shortly before my stay and was greeted with a welcome postcard and $10 to spend in the mini bar, which was nice. This also allowed me free access to the wi-fi, which was a bonus.
reviews.title: great stay
A Cool Place with Terrific Service
reviews.text: I traveled to DC for 2 days of meetings. We are from Iowa and so we booked it sight-unseen...but it had a good price, good location for us, and it looked like something different. I am so glad that we picked it! The place is totally cool. Unique and different for sure! There are no boring colors in this hotel. The service was crazy good. I got an email from them before our departure, so I updated them as to our possbile delay getting in. While there, our meetings ran long and the front desk was so wonderful. They took care of our lugguage and kept their cleaning crew there for our room!

We were able to enjoy the Bar Rouge one night and loved the menu selection. The bar manager was great and took our advice regarding a future purchase regarding one of their Iowa vendors. Great place and I look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Rouge for 3 nights with my 2 adult daughters and we all enjoyed our stay. The hotel is well located, being around the corner from a Wholefoods restaurant and close to a restaurant that serves vegetarian food, near a subway and close to the White House.
reviews.title: Good value, comfortable stay

reviews.text: The staff were, without exception friendly and helpful and our room was clean and comfortable. Valet parking is available right next door.
reviews.title: Rouge Good for Families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying there again soon.
reviews.title: A nice boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In town for a wedding and most guests stayed at the Rouge. Excellent hotel and location but the service is what stood out. Particular kudos to the bar/restaurant staff for catering to our every need. The red lobby and halls at first make you feel that you've stumbled into some sort of hipster palace but the staff couldn't do more to make our stay pleasant. The location is excellent with DuPont circle just a short walk away.
reviews.title: Cutting Edge but Not Too Much

reviews.text: I attended a conference in DC a few weeks ago and decided not to stay at the conference hotel due to some experiences during my last stay that I do not want to mention in detail. I found the Rouge in walking distance to my conference hotel and decided to give it a try. I really enjoyed my stay and will be back for more. The problem is that Kimpton has quite a few options in DC and I am sure to try them all out.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I took advantage of the free one-night parking for my red car but had to miss the evening wine receptions due to other commitments. The staff was super friendly but the recommendation for a nearby dinner spot was a little off for my taste (sub par recommendation). Not a big deal. Loved the room design and setup. I think I had a separate couch in a pretty large room for one person. Bathroom was small but efficient. The only gripe I had was the elevator noise coming from a wall right behind the bathroom. Next time, I will make sure to double-check the distance to the elevators before taking my room key. I enjoyed their french toast for breakfast a little bit too much as I kept coming back every morning. I was concerned at first to read more about the 'extreme' (in a positive way) pet friendliness and was surprised to find the room was super clean and fresh. Keep in mind, I have two cats at home but I am not a fan of cat hair all over the place.
reviews.title: Great staff; Always a great stay

reviews.text: After Kimpton accepted my other hotel chain loyalty level match request, i will make sure stay here and at other Kimptons more often.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!!

reviews.text: I always stay at Kimpton Hotels when in DC - there are several in the Dupont Circle neighborhood. Hotel Rouge has a small but impressive lobby, where a Wine Reception is held nightly, open to you and your outside guest. The attached bar is quite stylish, and serves food as well. On this stay the $260 rate was higher than usual, I was told because of a convention in town. There is a charge for parking, but you get 1 day free parking if your car is red (rouge). Room was clean and stylish, with laptop-sized room safe. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Due to an approaching snowstorm, I changed my stay from 3 to 2 nights. It was no problem at the front desk when I made this request late in the evening and left the next morning. Be sure to join the Kimpton InTouch Frequent Guest program before you arrive, and you will get free Internet in your room and a coupon for $10 free snacks from the in-room mini-bar. Your stays will also then accommulate to free stays. Also, if your stay starts in less than 7 days, they have Last Minute Rates online for InTouch members. You can apply a AAA Auto Club discount for a cheaper rate on all reservations. Be aware, this and all Kimpton Hotels, are pet friendly, so you may encounter dogs in the elevator and hear woofs from behind room doors. I have also stayed at Kimpton Hotel's Madera and Topaz nearby the Rouge, and I would certainly return to any of them.
reviews.title: Fun, cool, and gracious.

reviews.text: I travel to DC frequently. So, I have stayed in a lot of different hotels from the big chains to the historial or boutiques or discount places. This is my favorite hotel. Now - it is not for everyone. It has bright red walls in the hallways, leopard spotted carpet, orange chest of drawers, wax lips in the mini bar, tiger striped terry robes. You probably get the sense of the place. But that sense of fun carries into the staff's attitude. These are smiling folks who want to help you.
reviews.title: It has personality

likes.liked: — The attitude of the hotel and the staff.
likes.disliked: — Not much choices on eating in immediate area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are great, linens top rate. It is one of the few places I visit where I can actually sleep the first night there. Bath tub could use an update, but lots of hot water. Aveda products.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: Rooms are quiet. Free internet. Small stereo in each room with a selection of discs for your pleasure.
reviews.title: paint the town red--stay at rouge!

reviews.text: I simply adore this place and always stay there now when I go to DC when the price is right. Hotel pricing is DC is totally unpredictable. Sometimes they have wanted $400 a night at the Rouge, other times just over a $100. So, check it out if you are going there. It is a fun and memorable experience.
reviews.title: Feeble attempt to be a "W"

reviews.text: We stayed at Rouge for our first visit to DC and loved it! The hosted wine hour was such a unique and fun idea as well as the cold pizza the next morning. Everyone in the Rouge had a welcoming smile and the service was personal and warm. The diverse and upbeat crowd of guests was a delightful surprise and portrayal of DC culture. We will definitely come back to stay at Rouge and recommend to all our friends!
reviews.title: Trying Hard But Needs More Staff Training

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights this past weekend, when I came for DC Tap Fest. I am happy to say that my stay was enjoyable and that the Hotel Rouge or its staff did not disappoint. They were friendly, courteous, and very efficient both at check in and check out. My room was tastefully decorated, clean, and the bed was very soft and comfortable. The hotel offers an evening wine reception that I recommend, as well as a bloody mary reception on Saturdays from 11-noon that's also fun. The hotel is well located, just a very easy walk to DuPont Circle restaurants and bars. Whole Foods Market is only a two block walk away on P Street between 15th and 14th. DuPont Circle Metro is about a five block walk away up Massachusetts Avenue. If you're coming on the weekend, I personally would recommend looking for parking on-street as it is not time limited in the area on weekends, is available, and the hotel valet is rather expensive at $40 per night. I have to say, I was very impressed with the Rouge and will definitely consider them for my future travel plans.
reviews.title: Great hotel stay for DC Tap Fest!

reviews.text: Spent a long weekend here with my husband. Upon check-in I indicated we have several pieces of luggage and would need valet...I had to ask for a bellman and for valet. They did not offer..at this point I knew it wouldn't be a typical kimpton. The valet person was rude and I felt he found my dogs annoying. They were barking after a 7 hr drive in the car..he rolled his eyes a few times. The rooms were fine, clean and nicely sized..I had requested that few items be in our room upon check-in & they were not, but were delivered several hours later... the location is fine but plan to walk if you're site seeing. The best part was Lukas at the bar. He was very kind and accommodating. Leigh was also very pleasant during wine hour. Lily was terribly rude ( breakfast server). We asked if we could substitute an item (same price) she said no because the prices were different when they certainly were not. She needs to be versed in the menu. Also she did not ask us for our drink order or bring us silverware. We will stay with kimpton again , just probably not this hotel. First impression is key & I felt they missed the bar..except for Lukas and Leigh, they were great.
reviews.title: Not your typical Kimpton experience

reviews.text: This hotel is everything you'd expect from a Kimpton. The room was immaculate, the bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was well soundproofed. I could hear sound in the hall, but lot my room.
reviews.title: Great sleep- great food

reviews.text: The bar staff is friendly and engaging, but know when to leave you to your book. There's a whole foods and plenty of restaurants in walking distance. Stay here.
reviews.title: Disappointment for the Kimpton chain- rowdy, loud, meh staff and slowest elevators in DC

reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of Kimpton hotels (check my previous reviews, I usually rave). This is not only a disappointment relative to the extremely high standards of the Kimpton chain, but an unpleasant hotel in general. I won't stay here again. I'm returning to D.C. in a few weeks and had two options on the Kimpton reservations site - this hotel or a Kimpton in Alexandria, and I chose the Alexandria Kimpton even though it puts me out of the District. It was that bad.
reviews.title: Returning Business Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How do I start this review? I can't wait to tell you that this was one of my best experiences with hotel... I’ve been around a lot... I arranged this last minute deal online. We got there and SURPRISE. Excellent choice. The decor is funky, red funky. Front desk was very nice and helpful Went to my room and it was big and comfortable. Closer to everything… a few blocks away from the White House and other interesting places. Breakfast was OK but the service was nice. The complementary glass of RED wine is a nice touch. Price: very good!
reviews.title: Very Nice Red Rooms and Great Price!!!

reviews.text: I spent one night at Hotel Rouge and thought it was funky & fun. The decor has tons of red in it, and it's certainly not your typical chain hotel. It's a converted apartment building and it shows. I liked the decor and the free wireless internet access. What didn't I like? The bed was a little soft. The room was somewhat dark (to enhance the funky feeling, I'm sure), and that made it hard for me to work going through papers and using my laptop. I would have liked more overhead light. I forgot a toothbrush, and they did not offer complementary ones ... they were $5.50 from the minibar! Finally, the bar on the ground floor of hotel allows smoking, so when you walk in, you are assaulted by a blast of nasty cigarette smoke. The hotel is very similar to the other nearby Kimpton Hotel, Hotel Madera, at least in terms of funky decore. But Hotel Madera has a better location and no nasty smoke pit on the first floor. But all in all this was a fine place to stay and I would do so again, although it wouldn't be my first choice.
reviews.title: Funky & fun, but not really for work

likes.liked: — fun decor, not your regular chain hotel
likes.disliked: — blast of nasty smoke in the lobby from bar on the first floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a 30-something from New York City, and stayed in Hotel Rouge for two nights while visiting my brother. Found a great rate of $129 on the hotel website (September 2006). Pleasantly surprised, and I'd recommend this hotel to any type of traveller. I did my research looking for a clean, modern hotel in a good neighborhood at a reasonable rate - not many to be found in DC. King room was HUGE and I believe most rooms are quite large. Nice white linens with down comforter. Rooms have a red vibe with black accents. Large full-length mirror, leather headboards, an innovative minibar with candy and such. CD player with iPod input was a good extra (bring your own iPod adaptor). Service (from booking to room service) was solid. Location's great in Dupont Circle which is one of the sweetest 'pedestrian friendly' areas in DC with good restaurants and shops, yet the White House is several blocks from the hotel. Aveda products are a nice plus. As are animal-print robes. Note that there's a putatively 'swanky lounge'-type place as part of the ground floor, and there is something of a smoke smell that seems to permeate to the hallways a bit. At least some of the vibe is a party hotel on weekends. Really this place is a great find and I'm booked there again over Thankgiving holiday in late November for $139/night.
reviews.title: Huge Rooms, Great Location, Good Deals Too

reviews.text: A friend and myself were travelling through the US and stayed at Hotel Rouge. The rooms were big & spacious & clean. It was a great location and we were able to walk to most attractions. After travelling for about 8 weeks it was great to finally get some rest in such comfortable beds! The staff were helpful and met all of our needs whenever we required.
reviews.title: Loved the Rouge

likes.disliked: — waiting so long for a taxi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Rouge for 4 nights (August 26-30) and everything was great. At check-in the staff was prompt, informative, courteous, helpful and let us check in early. Yes, they have a theme and it's meant to be very hip and trendy, but I didn't find it to be annoying or too "in your face."
reviews.title: Rouge gets a huge yes

likes.liked: — Quiet and clean, convenient to the Metro (subway)

description: On Washington DC's historic Embassy Row, Hotel Rouge is a superb luxury boutique accommodation. This Kimpton Hotel is a playful and colorful urban retreat at the doorstep of the city's top cultural and historic attractions. Within blocks of Dupont Circle and near the White House, National Mall and countless museums and galleries, the alluring Hotel Rouge entices with its rejuvenating décor, exceptional service, signature amenities and adjacent Bar Rouge lounge.
